Reviews.Title: “Good value with ocean view”
Reviews.Author: Msjuicylover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on a friend's recommendation. Hotel was basic but had ammentities such as microwave, fridge, wi-fi, and free parking. Beautiful ocean views and walking distance to shops and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: CheD89
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a beautiful location, right in the middle of Ocean Beach..a nice, friendly community. It is steps away from the sand and waves. The room was really nice. The bed was unbelievably comfortable, a memory foam mattress. There was a flat screen tv, a microwave and a fridge. Conveniently, there was also a washer, dryer and vending machine available to use downstairs. The staff was friendly and helpful. I had a great experience staying at the Ocean Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Roromarie
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff Very clean. Not fancy but beautiful patio and view of ocean. Can hear the waves and view them grom some rooms and the patio. Ocean across the street. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Prime location!”
Reviews.Author: MarySumSum
Reviews.Content: Love the location. staff very friendly and helpfull. We have stayed there several times, this last time there were many upgrades. Including new wood floors,new lcd tv's, and paint . Also the court yard has been redone. Can be loud. Just request to be in a room that doesnt have anyone in the surrounding rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Luck of the Irish”
Reviews.Author: erin b
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Ocean Beach Hotel during St. Patty's weekend. The hotel is literally right on the beach. The front desk attendants were very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is cute, a little older, but still clean and nice. The only draw back and yet at the same time a plus, is the lack of MTS public transportation to Ocean Beach. It keeps a lot of the tourists away, but you'll have to take a taxi to get there. We loved the Ocean Beach neighborhood. Great antique shops and boutique shops in the area. Definitely going to stay here again. Thanks for the wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa S
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego but wanted to find a good weekend Beach Getaway! The OB Hotel was a perfect choice! It has an amazing and friendly staff! Brad, Jill & Sam were all very helpful and accommodating! The rooms are clean and cozy! I really like the fact each room has its own Fridge. It's in prime location - only steps away from the beach, shops, restaurants, and bars! Has a very cute courtyard! I LOVED laying on my bed to see the ocean and beautiful sunset! We will defininately go back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhh!”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyShelley_12
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Ocean Beach Hotel for the past 17 years. When we lived in San Diego I would take my son there during the holidays to let him experience Thanksgiving, Christmas and the New Year on the beach. These are special times because of the tree and Santa Claus right there with the ocean as a backdrop. The inner patio area is beyond gorgeous. My most recent stay could have lasted forever and it wouldn't be enough. The staff, the veiw, the price is always right. The rooms are fresh with a microwave and refridgerator. Fish off of the peir (no license needed) and a cafe to boot. I could go on and on but, if I were you, I would start visiting once or twice a year (like we do). It is the perfect way to unwind and rejuvenate. We love it there and personally I wish we were still there right now. Shelley Shelley Westcliffe, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Alway's Reliable and a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: lifeisgood2012
Reviews.Content: A large group of us have been going to this hotel for years. It has been remodeled, has a great courtyard, is just steps from the beach and everything else in OB (resturants, shops, pubs). There are a variety of rooms, we always take the basic room and have no complaints. Our room was small but very clean and the bed was great! There were about 20 of us on this last trip and I don't think anyone had any complaints. Can't beat the location or the price and we will be back. Thanks OB Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbol
Reviews.Content: What a great time that was had at the Ocean Beach Hotel. Check in was quick and friendly, the rooms were basic yet very clean and comfortable. I was very surprised at how comfortable the beds were. But the biggest plus for the hotel? The location...there are not many hotels in San Diego that are as close to the beach as this yet, be on the main strip to walk amongst all the OBsians. The room had a balcony with a nice ocean view. Yes, I can imagine it can get noisy if you have loud neighbors and you are on Newport Ave in the middle of Ocean Beach so I'm sure it can get a little "animated" during the season...but you are in Ocean Beach, it's kind of expected, right? I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fun family weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Joshua S
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very freindly and even though we arrived several hours before check-in they were able to get us into our room. The room was clean and slept our family of four comfortably. The location is outstanding, just steps from the beach and numerous resturants, surf shops, gift shops, cafes, etc within blocks of the hotel. The kids had a great time and we will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousByNature
Reviews.Content: The OB Hotel is not fancy, more of a motel, really, but it's comfortable, clean, inexpensive, friendly and located close to all of the main attractions in San Diego. It's older but lovingly mainained. There are tons of inexpensive places to eat within walking distance, spas, surf shops, bars, groceries and some nicer restaurants, too. You get the feeling of the surfer community, being across the street from a public beach. We watched the beach action all day long while sitting in the courtyard with the fountain gurgling. Seaworld is a few minutes' drive away. There are city buses going to from the hotel to almost anywhere you'd want to go. The staff is friendly and helpful. It got a bit noisy at night, since the walls are pretty thin, but I would definitely go back. If you're in a taxi to and from the airport, specify Narragansett Avenue. It's the straightest route.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, Great for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just moved to San Diego, Ocean Beach area from Santa Fe, New Mexico (though, we are originally from Seattle). We moved without a place to live in Ocean Beach, and did a quick search on the Garmin to find a hotel in Ocean Beach. The Ocean Beach Hotel popped up. We called and they mentioned the very reasonable prices. Once we got there, I noticed the hotel is literally across the street from the OB pier and ocean. Rooms are incredibly clean, cute, and makes you feel you are at home. Honestly, I did not want to leave! The service was outstanding, and we had no trouble staying a few nights, while we searched for an apartment. The parking lot is behind the hotel, but has video cameras, since we had packed our lives in the Subaru, we wanted to make sure it was secure. We never had any problems. There is a great Taco shop a few yards from the hotel, which is open late. A plethora of restaurants and bars are within walking distance. Everyone that worked at the hotel was very friendly and helpful, answering all our questions. We will definately be back, and I encourage you to try it! - Cassandra Conner

Reviews.Title: “AGAIN AND AGAIN OUR FAVORITE PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Sanchbraj
Reviews.Content: all the times that we vist san diego the best opcion to stay is the ob hotel, the staff is great , and im in love WITH THE HOTEL, THIS LAST VISIT WHE STAY AT THE SUITE OH MY GOD IT WAS GREAT to wake up and see the beach trough the window is magic, its and amaizing location and the place highly recommended i love it

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Noreen H
Reviews.Content: The location is great for several reasons. First, the courtyard is beautiful - you have a great view of the beach.When you venture outside of the hotel you have the beach across the street and all of the shops, bars and restaurants OB has to offer. The rooms are small but have everything you need (even a mini fridge and microwave). The room was clean but the bathroom was cramped and I felt I had to wear my flip flops in the shower. All that being said, I will be staying here again because of the location and great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Sub par, but not a roach motel”
Reviews.Author: Hanzosbm
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in order to avoid driving after going to the bars nearby. I am a local, so I knew that OB was a hippie, dirtbag hangout. But, this was still a let down. The bed was comfortable, but the room was noisy, a bit smelly and the bathroom was cramped, moldy and grungy. I didn't feel unsafe staying there, but it was the worst hotel room I've ever stayed in. I want to be fair and resist bashing it, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, price and view!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melodee T
Reviews.Content: For Valentineâ€™s Day I wanted a hotel right on the ocean that was affordable yet nice. I had heard mixed reviews of The Ocean Beach Hotel but the location and price were perfect so I decided to find out for myself. I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are on the small size but how much time do you spend in your room anyway. The rooms are very nicely decorated and come with a mini-fridge and a microwave, which are a nice touch. The front desk clerks were very pleasant. The best part about it was we were told we did not have an ocean view but as you can tell by the attached picture, our view was great! The caution tape in the picture is due to the fact they are remodeling the patio area, which should be lovely when they are done. In addition, the location on Newport Avenue is perfect as the whole street is lined with restaurants, bars and tons of clothing stores. We will definitely stay here again and have recommended it to all of our friends!!

Reviews.Title: “The best view of Ocean Beach”
Reviews.Author: psc1963
Reviews.Content: The front ocean view rooms are 25 yards from the sand. Rooms are clean and updated. Best people watching at the beach was right from the French doors of our 2nd floor room. Courtyard has great views as well. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Bed was comfortable. Free parking was easy and a great asset at this location. Shades restaurant next door has a good breakfast. Lighthouse ice cream across the street has best rocky road ice cream we've ever had. Pier walk is nice and so is the cafe out on the pier. Locals are friendly. Bums are around the beach but aren't bothersome. Neighborhood is scary at night though due to the nearby dive bars. If you want a nice dinner drive to someplace outside of OB.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and location & price!!”
Reviews.Author: blueyedevil
Reviews.Content: I love ocean beach hotel. Always a great stay.the only nice hotel down there.It's on the best street. Plenty of foods shops and bars near by.I loved their court yard. The ocean is literally across the street. I love this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Diana D
Reviews.Content: We loved it, loved it, loved it! We celebrated our 52nd wedding anniversary here right on the beach. There were lifeguards on the beach for the kids and restaurants right around the corner. The amazing staff will help you with anything you need. LOVE their courtyard which is enclosed and perfect for children to be to play in a safe environment. Dog friendly hotel and beach. There is no place you're going to find a hotel that close to the water at that price. It is truly San Diego's best kept secret.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: pi_ki59843
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite place to stay in San Diego! Weâ€™ve vacationed in San Diego many times and have stayed at the Ocean Beach Hotel for each visit. The hotel is located right next to the beach, and the immediate area also offers a variety of shopping, and restaurants. The hotel is not affiliated with any major franchise, but the rooms are priced very affordably, are clean, and provide great views of the ocean, beach and pier. Canâ€™t beat watching the sunsets from here! We plan to come back and stay there again when we visit San Diego in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqulyn S
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much Ocean Beach Hotel for making my experience in Ocean Beach amazing! The rooms were clean, updated and the staff was excellent. Love the location being walking distance to the fun shops, restaurants and bars!

Reviews.Title: “A Beachside Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: mrsgardea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in need of a long awaited weekend away (and alone!) for our 6 year anniversary. We wanted to have a beach town experience, and boy we did!! The location was AMAZING! It was literally across the street from the beautiful Ocean Beach. Everything you could think of was in walking distance. The Pier was right there that went about a half mile into the ocean, with a cute little cafe at the end. The hotel was an old hotel that is currently still being remodeled. It was small and intimate, just perfect for us. Even though the building is old, they put in new furnishings and the beds are SOOOOOOO comfortable!! That's the most important! They had a microwave and mini fridge as well. The experience was indescribable. We had having everything you could want in walking distance, an ocean view from our room, and the sound of the waves were all around us. It was the most romantic trip we've ever had. We plan on making trips to this hotel for years to come!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Beautiful Views!”
Reviews.Author: Aemsurfer
Reviews.Content: This small but gorgeous hotel was everything I could have asked for on valentines day! Upon arrival, the hotel looks very normal..... until you step into the BEAUTIFUL courtyard that overlooks the beach right in their backyard! VERY friendly staff and a great beach hotel vibe! Will definitely be staying here again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean view and nice rooms at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya B
Reviews.Content: I recently got a room at OB hotel and was pleasently surprised by the room. We had our own private patio with ocean view! Our room also was good sized with two queen beds, a flatscreen and a mini fridge. The price was also very reasonable. I would definently stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: NVEME702
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the location! It's perfectly placed at the end of a street where you take two steps outside the hotel and you're on the beach- it's great! The street is full of restuarants & shops and we found it difficult to find a place to eat because everything looked so good. The room was small but when you're in San Diego who needs a big room anyways? Nice fixtures, clean and a comfy bed, which is always a plus! Overall, if you're looking for inexpensive, no frills hotel with a great locations and tons of stuff to do within walking distance this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Happ_E_Traveler_12
Reviews.Content: Needing a place to stay while in the middle of moving, I checked into the Ocean Beach Hotel not knowing what to expect. Needless to say I was pleasantly surprised with a more than reasonable price to boot. My single room was stylistically furnished in modern minimalist fashion with flat screen LED TV with cable, climate control unit, microwave, and fridge. The queen size that provided the best sleep that I've experience in a long time and the bathroom was exceptionally clean with hot and powerful water pressure from the shower. I like the Ocean Beach Hotel so much that I'm going back this weekend to take advantage of it's proximity to the beach, friends, and night life. Thanks for your wonderful hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing deal!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry U
Reviews.Content: This hotel is always a great spot, they are re-modeling their rooms and outside area and it looks great. Our room was right next to the water, and was very clean! I will def. be heading back there, the price is right and it is downtown and on the water (and the beds are soft, which is sometimes hard to find)! Thank you Ocean beach hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for awesome beach front location”
Reviews.Author: Rebekkah R
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego and just wanted to rent a hotel room for my birthday to 'get away' from my usual. I called for a single room on a Saturday night and surprisingly they had a room available. The one bedroom was reasonably priced for being right on the beach in Ocean Beach. I always walked by this hotel assuming only "rich people" could afford to stay there. The room was simple kinda like a motel 6, but the view and location was awesome. The night life is literally next door and across the street, however the rooms at night were still quite....amazing. My only complaint was that in the morning, I could hear people getting ready and gathering outside my door as they left for the day. I stayed in the courtyard (it was cheaper) and I could still enjoy the ocean view and the sound of the waves from the balcony. Also, they allow dogs and have a teacher discount!! I love OB

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: nydia21
Reviews.Content: A great place, just across the street is the beach. We are going back in a couple of month. Can't wait!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Miss leading add on internet.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn K
Reviews.Content: Their add said it was an old hotel but had been renovated...well that is not true, anyway our room had not been redone. Smelled moldy, and very unkept. Outside was in need of repair and paint. Our room had paint pealing in the bathroom, rust on front of refrigerator, very thin walls, no elevator. The surrounding properties, were full of homeless people, people on drugs, we were uncomfortable walking on the street. It is right on the beach, but when you can not enjoy it because of the surroundings, very overpriced. They had people working in the patio area after 10pm. I found out later that ocean beach was basically known for hippy type. Do not believe what you see in their add.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the 5 star we stayed at the night before.”
Reviews.Author: dextercherjer
Reviews.Content: Great location.We came during the Farmers Market,it was great.The staff is very friendly and helpful.We brought our baby and what a help they where.Very clean rooms,my socks barely got dirty.Smelled great,clean,comfy, and a good experience for my family.This hotel is on the ocean and very affordable in these times.We stayed here 3 years ago and that's why we came back.I highly recommend this hotel and will come back.Thanks Ocean Beach Hotel for the great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very fun with Amazing View!!”
Reviews.Author: Aaron P
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had the best time here.Waking up to the waves and the ocean right in your face.Everyone had good vibes making it so easy to relax.I can't wait to go back!!The service was great ,and its surronded by some of the best restraunts and bars on the West Coast.Surfing in the area is world class too.Im going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Sue V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had reservations for two nights at the Ocean Beach Hotel, and ended up extending it as we were so pleased with the location, and the friendly, helpful staff. The room was spotless and near restaurants. On Wednesday evening is a streetfair with so much to see that we spent hours there. We will definately be back to the hotel and are telling our friends about it too.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend...”
Reviews.Author: marty h
Reviews.Content: Right in the mix of everything fun...OB Hotel has just been remodeled over the past 2 years and is a great place for a wknd get away....the sand is right accross the street and Newport Ave is loaded with great restaurants, pubs and shops...The staff is very friendly and helpful...I will definitely return...thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Estevan R
Reviews.Content: I will really recommed this hotel. it was my first time in san diego and really loved the location of the hotel all the bars abd resturants where all walking distance very convient. We had a beautiful view of the ocean and the pier. Really loived the the quit and pece full enviroment, and the staff was really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: Missevapaiva
Reviews.Content: In the heart of OB, next to EVERYTHING! My roof was being fixed & we needed a local place to stay for the night during construction. The staff is extremely friendly & I love the remodeling they have done! Way to go OB hotel! I will send friends & family your way when they come to cali for holiday! I've stayed in hotels in PB & it gets loud, the OB hotel all can be heard is the ocean waves! Free coffee in the lobby is a total bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location!”
Reviews.Author: jaroknii
Reviews.Content: Awesome location! Right next to the beach. All the bars and restaurants are near too!

Reviews.Title: “I <3 OB”
Reviews.Author: AliciaB2
Reviews.Content: I am originally from San Diego but haven't lived there in about six years. Every time my boyfriend and I come to visit, we stay at the OB hotel. We've been there seven times and I wouldn't go anywhere else. You can't beat the location- right by the beach, pier, TONS of bars, Java Jungle (a must for the mornings) and tons of bars and eateries. The courtyard is gorgeous (currently being renovated), the staff is friendly and the rooms are clean and plenty big for the two of us. Also, since it's the off-season and we stayed during the week we got our rooms for less than $70 a night. I was stoked! I love Ocean Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Days at OB Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle J
Reviews.Content: Great time staying at the OB Hotel. Walking distance to good food, shopping and the Java Jungle!! Park your vehicle and walk everywhere for 3 days of Beautiful Beaches, OB Pier and great clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Nomad_Geri
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 3 children for two nights and it was clean, in a great [perfect] location, and the staff couldn't have been more friendly. The parking out front is a plus and all you hear at night are the waves crashing just steps away. I'll be back in 2 weeks and I know where I'll be staying!

Reviews.Title: “it's not a place, it's an attitide”
Reviews.Author: barry w
Reviews.Content: if you are thinking of traveling to southern california (specifically san diego)...you have to consider the ocean beach hotel...as the title says, "it's not a place, it's an attitude"...i have lived in o b for 31 years...this past christmas( just a few days ago), i was given a gift of the ocean beach hotel...relaxing, the beach and ocean just steps away, and the great little community of ob (as us locals call it) made for a great getaway...the to do's are hodad's hamburgers, a walk on the pier, many great little bars (with great craft beers), the black (a head shop dating back to the 1970's) and the ambiance that makes o b...thanks

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE OB!”
Reviews.Author: YUYU1219
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 12/18 and checked-out on 12/21. From the very first phone call and until check-out, he staff was very friendly and accommodating. They made my birthday stay very comfortable. I would like to go back one day and experience the courtyard, which was being renovated during our stay. The hotel is located just steps from the beach and right next to a fantastic restaurants and shopping. Esther and Jill, thanks so much!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect beach getaway spot”
Reviews.Author: kix1007
Reviews.Content: Ocean Beach Hotel is one of the most perfectly located beack hotel spots that I've ever stayed. From the balcony of my room, I had a million dollar view of the Pacific Ocean accented with the historic OB Pier. The hotel is located just steps from the beach and is located right next to a fantastic restaurant/shopping district. Every time I've ever stayed in the hotel, we are treated wonderfully by the staff at OB Hotel. We intend on staying there on every future San Diego visit! Thanks so much for a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in OB....”
Reviews.Author: LIVINGlifewithGI
Reviews.Content: Found this place amazing the staff were all lovely, the place was great really clean with a great courtyard and the best view you could ask for. The location was the best thing about this place near everything restaurants, bars and beach with a sunset out your front door.Would definitely stay with Ocean Beach hotel on my next stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “When I stay in san diego, I always stay here”
Reviews.Author: kimlbc
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, small, charming, clean, cute, great view, peacefull courtyard. When I stay here i usually bring a friend and they love it. Its right across from the beach, and super close to tons of restaurants and shops. You cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: cruz777
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room great location for the price, right on the beach. I would definitely recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THiS HoTEL greAT serviCe aNd loCATion !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sanchbraj
Reviews.Content: Every time I got a chance to visit San diego we go to this hotel, thE sTAff has ALWaYs been niCe and frieNdly. AnD theres reaLly good plaCes to haNgout nearby. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Such a home like environment nestled in the unique area of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Lemondbike
Reviews.Content: I got the privilege to stay in this unique corner of the grand San Diego Metropolis. With beautiful views of the ocean across street, and an enclosed courtyard, the Ocean Beach Hotel is definitely a place you need to pinpoint on your map. Why? From the phone call being so pleasant, to the check in process being friendly, to the small details of making our interaction with the hotel staff comfortable, I would go again to this hotel soley on the fact that the employees will do their best to help you feel at home...at least for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than terrible...”
Reviews.Author: Caligirlatheart7
Reviews.Content: I don't even know how to begin describing this dump. The bed was horrible, the walls were paper thin and you could hear everything, our air conditioner stopped working so the lady had to come in our room to refill the water, our bathroom roof was leaking all over the place and probably collapsed right after we left...our bathroom was completely wet, we could have literally taken a shower with the water that was dripped from the roof. In all fairness, we did have a pet friendly room, but regardless there was so much wrong with this room. It was so disgusting. You are definitely just paying for the location. We had reserved 2 nights, left after one and could not get out fast enough. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the location”
Reviews.Author: kizzy85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here March 19-21 2011. The hotel is nice enough, but you're really paying for the location. We sprung for a king suite and our balcony was right over the corner of Newport and Abbott, just next to the beach. Pretty awesome. "King suite" sounds much more extravagant than the room actually was. We had some extra space and amenities such as a couch, mini-fridge, table and chairs, etc, but the room really wasn't much bigger than a king room at an average chain hotel. The bathroom was really small and the water temperature in the shower was all over the place, but we were only there for two nights, so it didn't cause a major headache. The bed was comfy and the TV had a ton of cable channels, not that we spent a whole lot of time in the room to watch. The staff we encountered seemed very friendly and laid-back -- we overslept and checked out about two hours later than we were supposed to, and no one at the front desk cared. If you are clueless about the area, you should know that it's got a distinct dirty hippie vibe, is packed with bars, and gets fairly rowdy especially on the weekends. On our first afternoon there, we were out on the balcony, plucking out a quiet tune on our guitar and mandolin, and we got a SUPER dirty look from our older next door neighbor. (We're no pros, but I promise we don't suck enough to warrant such a glare!) I bet he was loving his life a few hours later when the sun went down and the real noise started. We were in town specifically to have drunken fun ahead of a friend's wedding, so it worked out great for us -- but wouldn't be the best for someone looking for a peaceful beach retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 would have been an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Alicia C
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel! I wanted to stay at the beach so I chose one across the street from Ocean beach. This was a mistake. I had a patio room and the entrance door had rust around it. I opened the door and the smell in side was so overwhelming I couldn't fall asleep so I had to buy a scented candle that I burned the entire time I was there. The bathroom was very tiny and didn't look anything like the photos I have seen online. The old tile shower stall made me feel as if I would catch some sort of disease by stepping into it. The paint behind the sink (a good 4 inches thick). The toilet is partially under the sink so you have to sit sideways. There is no electrical outlet in the bathroom and no hair dryer. The telephone didn't work and neither did the remote control for the tv. The wooden blinds had been broken off about a 1/3 of the way down so I had to put a wash cloth over the area where the missing slat was. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. I left really early on my check out day so I wouldn't have to be there anymore. I went to San Diego to have a relaxing weekend and to pamper my self so I decided I would have a nice relaxing time at the beach but that was spoiled by this hotel. Oh yeah, I could hear the conversations easily through the wall of my neighbors and I actually was woken up by hearing my neighbor snoring. That is how thin the walls were. Lots of transients in this area so I was nervous the whole time thinking my car was going to get broken into. Seriously, save yourself some money and stay at Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING, overpriced, unhealthy, unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Victor Manuel E
Reviews.Content: Moldies in the bathroom (will also write an email to the board of health in San Diego), the entire building smells like strong detergent, the area around the hotel is inundated with homeless, drunk, drug adicted people. It is very loud. I was there with my children and wanted to do them something good: this hotel is NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY !!!! ...it is UNHEALTHY. The personell at the reception is not only incompetent, they are also unfriendly and disrespectful (and they do think that they are the only ones in the world speaking spanish. While I was requesting services in English they were talking disrespectful about me in Spanish until I responded in Spanish).

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING, WORST, EVER!”
Reviews.Author: judith f
Reviews.Content: Area around hotel inundated with homeless, drunk, druggies. Moldy, dirty, noisy, broken down hotel rooms...Sure it is across from beach but one room two nights and another room one night to the tune of $750! The lobby clerks ignored me while making phone reservations everytime I needed something. Do not be fooled by the website photos of rooms and area...very deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location across street from BEACH”
Reviews.Author: webdogbooTucson
Reviews.Content: Awesome beach location with easy access to everything you'd expect when headed to the beach. The hotel is somewhat tired and in need of updating/renovation. rooms are a bit noisy, but clean. central courtyard is very nice way to be able to watch beach activity through large windows without being subject to it. Hotel has their own parking in back of hotel which is a plus if you are driving. Hotel is dog friendly so keep that in mind if you care about that one way or another, dogs are limited to ground level units, I think. Not much in the way of amenities, coffee, ice, washer/dryer and internet via wifi. All sorts of eating and entertainment within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: florenceMinnesota
Reviews.Content: My husband & m7yself stayed at Ocean Beach for a few nites the beginning of August. We had previously checked it out a few years ago so we knew what to expect. We loved walking the beach and watching the sunset from the inner courtyard. We had a small patio facing Newport Ave where we enjoyed some wine and the street activity. I would say that obviously I did not notice the noise once the patio door was closed. We are not fussy, the bathroom could probably use some upgrading but everything was clean and that is what matters to me. Loved sitting in the courtyard with all the visiting dogs, hilarious! Take advantage of the hotels parking lot, area traffic is busy.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: ScottPinAZ
Reviews.Content: For travelers not acquainted with Ocean Beach (OB) culture, it's important to know that this little beach community is one of the last non-commercialized beach areas in CA. Ocean Beach Hotel is a well-loved little hotel literally steps from the surf and at the foot of OB Pier. It's a bit noisy in the evening and neighbors (and guests) can get a little rowdy. The staff here is super friendly and really tries to keep guests happy. This is probably not a hotel for a quite beach getaway. But it does sit right on one of the best beaches in Southern California and the rates are better than half of what you'd expect for the location.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced but they allow dogs, people partying outside your window, in airport flight path”
Reviews.Author: Sparrowxoxo
Reviews.Content: Ya know, honestly we had a good time but the place was definitely too expensive for what it is and you will not get much sleep. We don't mind being in a loud place with people having a good time and playing guitar outside our window so we enjoyed ourselves. If you want quiet this is not the place for you, nor is whole part of town. People are loud and rowdy in this neighborhood. We liked the lively atmosphere BUT I witnessed a shady drug deal and we saw a guy get arrested right outside of our room (separate incidents). It's an area where there are bikers and skaters and surfers (fun!) mixed with homeless junkies (not so fun). If you are a surfer you will love the waves here. The hotel itself was okay. We were traveling with our two dogs so our options for hotels were limited. The staff was very nice and the courtyard was pretty cute. However the room was super basic and bare and the towels are made of sandpaper. The pictures on their website make it seem like a much nicer place than it actually is. We got a room with a patio and it was $195 which, it was not a nice enough place to justify that rate. You can hear everything through the walls. It sounded like the people upstairs were moving furniture all night. And at about 6 am we discovered that we were in the airport flight path and I was woken by low-flying jets sounding like they might just land inside my room. So I really couldn't sleep past 6 in the morning. Another reason why we chose to stay in Ocean Beach was for the Dog Beach. The dog beach is actually a very very long walk from the hotel. But the dog beach (when we finally got there) was great and huge. There was a disturbing sign posted saying "Warning! Run-off" which we really didn't quite figure out what that meant. But no one else seemed disturbed by it (and I guess we are sheep so we just did what everyone else was doing and ignored it.) BUT the dogs had an excellent time! We would go back to Ocean Beach but we would stay in a quieter and nicer area and we wouldn't stay at the Ocean Beach Hotel again. It was okay but of course, it would have been nice if they mentioned the flight path thing.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations on ocean beach, good price, and Extremely clean”
Reviews.Author: ladykennyg1
Reviews.Content: I am from Phoenix where we have no beach and my boyfriend and I though it would be fun to go on a mini road trip to San diego to lay on the beach and relax. I was a little sceptical at first about staying at the Ocean Beach Hotel thinking that it was going to be "a dump" like what some other reviews has said...but it was the opposite!!! It looks just like shown on the website but make sure you get the right room because the pictures on the site ofcourse are going to be the suite rooms with views...not your basic standard room. Oh and the pictures on google earth are terrible pictures of the garden...it doesn't look that dumpy, those must have been taken in the winter, garden looks just the way it looks on the website. Ocean Beach is a "beach town" not a luxurious resort so if you want luxury, go somewhere else. If you want a nice place to relax, that is romantic then this is the right place. It had a more antique european style look. The room we stayed in had a shower no bathtub...which is fine because I don't want to be bathing in sand after I just came from the beach. As appose to what couple negative reviews said below there are FUN bars with pool tables, GREAT food dives, and CUTE antique stores. There WERE hippies hanging out all over the place but isn't that what you expect from a beach town?? By no means though does that mean there were bums around because we looked and we never saw any. As a matter of fact there wasn't one car in the area that wasn't made before the year 2008 at the Motel or the beach parking lot. There were very few people staying at the hotel there and we were there over a weekend. The Rooms did not smell BAD, the garden area smelled a little "musty" because it's on the inside of the Motel and if your room faces the garden then chances are that your room will have a musty smell if the window was left cracked open by the staff that cleans the room. The floors were very clean and I have high standards...I stripped the bed to look for bed bugs ( there weren't any), I checked under the bed, in the drawers, the whole room was spotless...I was actually surprised that this motel was cleaner then large Hotels that I have stayed at in resorts. The one negative to the room was that where we went in, it was a little warm and the towels felt a little damp...even though we could tell they were clean by the way they were folded. As soon as we turned on the air conditioner, it was fine. The lady at the front desk told us it was very secure and that has someone on guard 24 hrs a day. You can't enter the Motel Garden without a key. As far as it being roudy at night, The town does get a little packed but we were able to eat dinner in 20 minutes and get back to the room without any problems. This Motel was Exactly what we wanted. The room was little and cute which was what I wanted. It's right across the street from the beach...but not "across the street" as in far...it's literally 84 ft away from the beach. It has a beachy and california look atmosphere. The service at the hotel was excellent! We asked for an extra blanket because it gets chilly at night and they brought it to us right away. oh and someone said that they don't have heaters?! The heating temp unit is right on the wall!!!!!...idiots. Oh and the Doggy beach is about a half mile away, the walk through the houses are pretty. If you bring dogs with you I recomend it, they will love it and there are many nice dogs around...just beware of the aggressive ones because we saw a few. We stayed in the pet friendly room that faces the garden so you can take them right out. O would recommend asking for the pet friendly patio rooms so that way they can take care of their business their and not in front of a couple trying to see the beautiful scenery!! There is a great view into the garden from our window and the view from the garden to the beach was beautiful! Watch ot for the noisy people upstairs who like to stomp---if you don't bring pet I recommend getting a top floor room. Oh and we couldn't really hear the ocean because the water fountain outside was loud...but you can hear it in the garden We are definately coming back for sure!!! I will be posting videos on youtube so if your interestd in seeing what the rooms look like and if they're for you. look for videos posted by Ladykennyg1. Hope this hepls!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and price!”
Reviews.Author: Megan619
Reviews.Content: This place was just what we were looking for! Super cute rooms, right on the beach, casual atmosphere and great price. We are coming back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry but...Yuck!!!”
Reviews.Author: CAHWY1
Reviews.Content: Sorry, I am from San Francisco and thought it would be fun to travel down the coast to San Diego. This place looked decent on their web site. First we drove through the strip..packed full of grungy shops and food dives/bars. Young dirty hippy wanna bees hanging out everywhere. I looked at my sister and thought we better eat early and head back to the hotel. I can imagine it gets roudy at night. So at the end of the strip is the hotel and beach. We checked in and walked up a lot of stairs to our room...not impressed at this point...kind of scared to be there. I did not feel comfortable with the crowd staying there. We stood in the room for 2 mins before deciding we need to leave. Did not feel safe - it smelled BAD - no way was I sleeping in that bed or taking off my shoes for that matter. We took our bags back down all the stairs and the NICE lady at the front desk EASILY gave us our money back. Thank God we did not have to argue that one! Bummed out....we just wanted out of that area altogether. Headed north back up to Santa Barbara where we had a room the night before. Unless you do not care about being safe and clean do stay here. Not that we did... but I would recommed staying in Mission Bay area in the nicer hotels. Not on the beach but they looked better!!

Reviews.Title: “No heat! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Rororosie
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here unless you are young and hardy, don't mind seediness and dirt, nosie and inconvenience. I came during off season. First there was no heat in the room and the space heater DID NOT work. Finally one nice staff changed her office space heater with mine so I could sleep. Had to sleep with TV on due to noise from other rooms. There is no room service. Noises included hammering in the rooms next door and on my floor and floor below; loud girl screaming throughout the day in nearby room. Room and environment do not match the online website. Courtyard was messy and unkempt. There were beer cans and cigarette butts in the pottery decorations. Next day clerk refused to discuss refund for night I coudln't stay -- didn't want to get thoroughly ill on my vacation due to cold and lack of sleep so I moved, but I had a prepay through the web which was never refunded. I am sure the clerk was untruthful that the prepay had to be refunded through Orbitz, ( I didn't even book through Orbitz!) because as a privately owned hotel OF COURSE they couldve refunded all or part of my money! This lie was so egregious I couldn't even muster up the contempt to refute it. I would be embarrassed to have a person who would lie like that working for me. Stayed on 3rd floor. Not only is there no elevator, there is no one to help you with your bags to your room. There is no closet in the room, the hangers are right in your room. This place has a nice location. I think it would be fun for a surfer or someone but if you are a surfer with money, you would stll probably like a clean place with a sincere staff and maybe even heat in the winter. If you don't have money, you probably can't afford this mid-range price hotel anyway. I imagine this hotel is surviving by dint of its location; I can't imagine anything other aspect selling it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: 60750Lizzy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I love the unique character that is Ocean Beach, but I didn't realize you can stay in O.B. until my boyfriend took me to the Ocean Beach Hotel. We spent Valentine's weekend at the hotel and enjoyed our stay immensely. Within walking distance to the restaurants and shops on Newport Ave, the hotel is located directly across from the beach with spectacular views of the Pacific Ocean and the famous Ocean Beach pier. The service was exceptional and the room extremely comfortable and clean. Our favorite part of our stay was being serenaded to sleep by the sounds of the waves crashing against the beach. It was amazingly romantic and we will be back. Highly recommended for locals looking for a quick escape and anyone who enjoys falling asleep to the sound of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “musty old rooms,overpriced for what it is”
Reviews.Author: lookwho3
Reviews.Content: A young relative booked this room for us and was quite excited to have us stay in such a cool place. The web sight look ok and some of the reviews sounded good. We had a special rate of $79.00. We arrived tired and exhausted and ready to check in. The hotel is indeed across from the ocean and centrally located to the "action". However, it is old and the rooms are musty and dated. We looked at three rooms with varrious views. Ours had been a garden view for $79.00. We were shown additionaly two ther rooms, ( I thought it might get better, I was wrong) the price went up to $99.00 and the $ 119.00. SO, my advise: if you are young, and want to "hang out, man" and are not concerned with the old musty, dated decor of this place, then it's for you! Peace Man .....no really.

Reviews.Title: “If you really want to live the neighborhood, stay at the OB Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hallosw2045
Reviews.Content: First and foremost this review is long overdue, so I apologize to R for that! My wife and I came to San Diego for our first visit ever for both of us, and let me tell you, we had two Great days of weather, and an awesome host to show us around! We were fortunate in that we were able to stay at this Wonderful Hotel across the street from the beachâ€¦.the day of our arrival, there was a small gathering of vendors in the grass across the street, and I was able to purchase some of the best Beef Jerky I have had in quite a while! If you want to live, smell, breathe what OB is all about, this is the place to stay, I would venture to say that everyone that was in the area the couple days we were there, at some point came to the pier, or to see the awesome Christmas Tree that they set up every year, covered in beach balls and inflatable pool toysâ€¦.How cool is that! We stayed in the single Condo next to the hotel, and I tell you, there is nothing better that having your morning coffee and watching the surfers from your very own balcony, it was sweet! Next door is an awesome place for breakfast, and I have to admit, it was quite nice to have the man that runs the Hotel wave hello from next door while heâ€™s having his breakfast, I felt like I was home. The OB neighborhood surrounding the Hotel is very convenient to all kinds of places to eat, and plenty of night life, all within very reasonable walking distance so you donâ€™t have to bother getting in a car. We would definitely come back, and actually Iâ€™m making it a week next time because Iâ€™m going to learn how to surf! We highly recommend the OB Hotel to really live & feel the area.

Reviews.Title: “Flea Bag hotel-don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: myraturner
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the ads. This hotel was disgusting. Smelly and old, and an incredible rip-off. It was shabby and seedy.

Reviews.Title: “Unique,Beachy,Great Location ~quiet,romantic,walk to pier free fishing”
Reviews.Author: Krista48
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I googled hotels on the beach and found this one. Great little get away for us. Across the street from the beach. Everything in walking distance. Room on the 3rd floor. Great view! Stairs thou. Wednesday evening the street farmers market was awesome. Food, flowers, music. We went fishing on the pier a few times and caught 2 leopard sharks and 1 designer crab. Was interesting to watch him put stuff on his back. We thru all back, tag and release lol. Ate breakfast and dinner at the CAFE on the Pier. Was fantastic. Loved the tide pools too. Had a blast and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a quiet, romantic, beach community enviorment that fortuanatley comes with its quirkey people if you love to people watch. One for the scrap books. Thanks for a wonderful stay. Loved the Woody and Hodad's hamburger joint!

Reviews.Title: “You should be ashamed; what's it take to clean a carpet! Filthy, dirty, dump!”
Reviews.Author: SharnaA
Reviews.Content: OB Hotel owners you should be ashamed, take one room at a time and improve it. If you are residents, please donâ€™t let your friends or neighbors know that you charge $250.00 a night for people to be afraid of taking their shoes off. You can get Stanley Steemer to come in and at least clean your sticky sickening old smelly carpets. Rent the machine yourself!!!! Those bedspreads (brown cheap things) make you sick to even think about laying underneath them let alone sitting on them. Try being proud of your business!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iroostu2
Reviews.Content: If you prefer Hilton Garden, Hyatt, Courtyard do not stay here, this is a small time budget hotel, trying to pass as a 3-4 star by what it lists on the website. Plus: location, free parking, refrigerator, microwave. Minus: no elevator (lugged stuff up to 3rd floor), no WiFi in most rooms ,in-room phone didn't work, coffee only in lobby in small styrofoam cups( no lids), SMALL, smelly rooms, uncomfortable beds that shake, no closet, center courtyard looks inviting on the website bu twas in poor condition, dirty tables and dying plants Plus the only seating is cement benches! Be warned that only some rooms have been redone. You get what you pay for, its a $130 CA hotel, I wont go back.

Reviews.Title: “Damp Rooms, Dirty floors & walls, old bedding, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: canterhard
Reviews.Content: I decided to splurge & spend the $250 for one night on the ocean. We walked into our room & I was disgusted. I've stayed in aLOT of hotels, usually Motel 6, Comfort Inn, etc, and this is absolutely the dirtiest, oldest, outdated, and just plain disgusting room I've ever slept in. The bedding was old & damp, even the pillows were damp, the carpet looked ancient and filthy, the cloth seat chairs were filthy, the walls were even dirty. The balcony was very nice, the view was beautiful, and the location was AWESOME. LOVED the shower in the courtyard to get rid of the beach sand. The value in these rooms is ONLY the location. Period. Maybe we just got a filthy dirty room and maybe some of the rooms are nice, but as a single mother who struggles financially, I was really excited to splurge just ONCE and get a nice room for my girls for our short stay in San Diego (our 2nd vacation in 15 years). It was really disappointing. But the location was nice, except for the guy walking buy our balcony talking about getting stoned, and there are some scary people at Ocean Beach, but lots of real nice people too.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff in an overpriced and dated environment”
Reviews.Author: barneyDublin
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the reviews here and was a little bit wary, but really wanted to stay somewhere near a beach after attending a conference in San Diego. Ocean Beach is a great little haven to relax in, and the Ocean Beach Hotel seemed ideal. But don't think of it as a cute little piece of luxury on the beach. Think of it as a dated and rusty motel opposite the beach with friendly staff in a laid back suburb. For the price of 220 dollars for a night, I could have stayed in pretty much any hotel in San Diego through Hotwire or similar. But maybe some people think 220 dollars is cheap for a rusty motel room?

Reviews.Title: “Great view and pretty courtyard - the room left MUCH to be desired!!”
Reviews.Author: shlomitaviva
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay as close to the beach as possible and this hotel certainly delivered! The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small, dirty carpets and had a funky smell. There wasn't really enough room for our luggage and it just didn't feel clean somehow. Not that you are there to hang out in the room all the time but we had the urge to AVOID the room! My partner didn't feel as strongly about it as I did. The shower was fine, clean, plenty of hot water, etc. I would say it's not worth it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a bit out of date, however good price”
Reviews.Author: Carasson
Reviews.Content: We did not know Ocean Beach at all before coming, se we were surprised that it was very much a party place. But we did not hear any of it from room, so that was good. We had a room with blocked toilet, and after 2 nights we switched rooms. We then noticed that our first room was much smaller than the next room we got. Our first room had no Internet connection although we were informed that we would have Internet. Second room had good Internet connection because if was closer to modem. There was free parking which was very good. The patio/garden of the hotel was very nice, but all in all rooms needed an upgrade. More room for clothing would be a pluss, and bigger baths. Great location - just next to the beach. Helpful staff..

Reviews.Title: “A great value !”
Reviews.Author: wallydoo
Reviews.Content: Was somewhat hesitant to book here .So glad we did ! We spent 9 nights and had a wonderful stay. Everyone was so friendly and our room was very clean and comfortable .We will definately return !

Reviews.Title: “Not the classiest, but LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: CasualTraveler17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to San Diego for a wedding. The bride and groom recommended the Ocean Beach Hotel on their website, since it was near the bar/restaurant where the after-party was taking place. We had a "garden view" queen room, but from our window, we had an amazing view of the sunset and surf. The garden had tables and benches, as well as a small alcove with benches that faced the ocean. It was a beautiful place to sit and watch the sunset, out of the wind. Our room was not HUGE, but there was a mini-fridge which was the perfect size for a couple of bottles of water, and some beer. The furniture seemed clean, as well as the bathroom. We had no problems with the shower in our room draining. Also, on a side note, I've noticed that it's not common anymore for hotels to provide complimentary conditioner. However, when I went to the front desk, the woman there provided me with some wonderful conditioner (although, it may have been her personal tub). I would not recommend this hotel for people who are expecting something fancy, but if you want a decent place to stay, that's right on the beach, this place is it. My husband and I will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “You Gotta stay here!”
Reviews.Author: thisoldshed
Reviews.Content: From Colorado.... It was -10 when I made the reservation... Spring break... Best holiday ever. Walking distance to some very good bars and restaurants. The Harp had a wonderful Lady bartending (Lisa). Ate/drank there several time a day... Antique stores were wonderful. Close to a liquor store and a convience store for Gatoraid and aspirin. Great place to crash. Clean rooms, fresh towels, sheets, etc. Water in shower was weak but high enough for a tall guy... Across the street from the beach. Picked up a $20.00 lawn chair....perfect (and cheap enough to leave for the housekeeping lady....) Get sunblock...I had 3rd degree burns from sleeping in the chair at the beach... Great folks living in OB---always felt welcome... (Except for a short bald guy from New York) I'm too old and fat to hook up with chicks... It ain't no Marriot or Hilton... I will definatley go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at OB Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dadreed1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 23 year old son stayed here for a week and were pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff was very helpful and the daily maid service was just excellent. Most of the rooms had more or less of an ocean view and the sound of the waves lulled you to sleep at night. Granted, the town has its share of characters, among them surfers, street performers, hippies, and some homeless, but all in all we had a great stay here. Rooms were clean, bathroom was small. We used the washer and dryer with no problems. Location was great - across the street from the beach and at the center of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy. Parties and fights both nights of our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Bussy01
Reviews.Content: Although the location was great, there is no way I would have stayed had I known the management allowed guests to throw parties in their rooms. After several hours of drinking and smoking marajuana, the fights soon followed. I say the management allowed this because I called and complained about the noise at 9:30 pm and was told "we usually try to squash it around 11." The fights started around 12:30 am. Needless to say, we were up all night, 2 nights in a row! Also, the room was extremely small, barely fit a full size bed in it, for 120.00 per night plus tax etc. Next time Ill stay in Hotel Circle. Its minutes from the beach and cleaner, cheaper and quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lousy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALEGALAZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel recently. The location is great for summer time if you are spending the time at the beach only. Otherwise, spend your money elsewhere. This hotel has free parking and a nice courtyard, thats it, the rooms were not at all, accomadating. They have one washer and one dryer, which rips your clothes, and takes 2 hours to dry. No hot water, no room service, the rooms were the size of a small master bedroom with a bathroom in it, old torn up furniture, and the beds were awful, I actually kept rolling off the bed. If you are only looking for a place to hit the beach, this is your hotel. The price is outrageous, so plesae take my advice, do not stay here, the website is very deceiving. We ended leaving after there was no hot water to shower. AP in AZ

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortable - could hear others having sex both nights”
Reviews.Author: Nusi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, but the rooms need to be renovated. The first room we stayed in had torn carpet, burn marks on the furniture, and a shabby bathroom. The sheets and toilet seemed clean, but everything else in the room was dusty and dirty. The second room we stayed in was in the same shape and the one our friends stayed in had mystery stains all over the carpet. The beds and pillows were hard and uncomfortable (I don't usually notice beds, but these were bad). The worst part of our stay was when the couple in the room next to us had loud sex (screaming, banging, etc.) and due to the paper thin walls it sounded like they were in the room with us. After blasting our TV to try to cover up the noise we called down to the front desk and they said they would ask them to quiet down but unfortunately that didn't work. We switched rooms to be away from that couple. The second night we were woken up by the sound of another couple having sex, but at least this couple wasn't trying to break any records for noise and duration. We slept horribly and were grossed out but I can't imagine how bad it would be for someone travelling with kids to have to hear that. This hotel needs to do some soundproofing since they aren't billing themselves as a youth hostel and are charging more than $120 a night.

Reviews.Title: “OBH A Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: chris1916
Reviews.Content: After spending a terrible night at another hotel near Sea World, I checked into this hotel and was quite surprised. Can't beat the fact that it is right across the street from the beach. Listening to the surf at night made my nights sleep very enjoyable. There is nothing fancy to this hotel. It is by far the best location and price in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Walking out of your room and smelling the Ocean!”
Reviews.Author: oceanpeace
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed being so close to the Ocean. The room was clean but too small. The room was a bit out dated but the good thing was it was clean and near the beach! I would go again, but not stay so long after 4 days we were really crowded!

Reviews.Title: “Great cozy place with EVERYTHING in walking distance”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell024
Reviews.Content: I was impressed - the Hotel was easy to find, parking was not a problem ( and this is a busy beach!), and there's plenty to do once you're ready to leave the water.....cafes and restaurants, shopping, people watching...all-around great get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, you cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: jessePhoenix
Reviews.Content: Our trip to san diego, and the first time staying in the OB area at the OB hotel was an incredible one. If your looking for a spot close to the beach, close to restaurants and bars and are in the mood for a chill relaxing vacation, the OB hotel is the spot to stay. OB probably isnt a spot for everyone, but we could not have had a better time. With the dog beach within a short walk, and the ocean yards away, you wont have to get in your car once you get their and park. The hotel staff including all the cleaning ladies were amazing!!! This place is a gem and the only reason Im second guessing this review is that I want to keep this place to myself. This place deserves all the business it gets though, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “A true Old school beach experience”
Reviews.Author: peacedawg
Reviews.Content: Staying at the O.B. hotel, is the opportunity so many dream of, but think its to expensive. The O.B. hotel is right on the ocean and on the main strip, its not full of gimmicks or overpriced gadgets it provides a comfortable cozy room and a view to stare at for hours. You not only become captured in the views and sounds of the waves crashing but you actually become one of the locals believing you actually live at the beach too. The only thing I might miss would be a dvd player to cuddle up with that special someone and watch the movie late at night! and the courtyard in the evening reminds me of spain with the old lights the hang and the lush gardens

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Rip Off - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: travelgeeks059
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room a couple of months in advance and were given a rate of about $150 per night for 3 nights. After making the reservation, I asked for a confirmation a couple of times but never received it, and forgot to continue following up (bad mistake #1). On arrival we were told that they didn't have us reserved until the next night. Also, without a confirmation, the rate was now $220, quite a bit more than promised. We had just driven over from Phoenix with our dogs and thought it would be hard to find a dog-friendly hotel last minute, so we checked in (bad mistake #2) without first looking at the room (bad mistake #3). (Also, we fortunately discovered that most hotel chains are dog friendly these days.). At the promised price of $150, we would have tolerated the disgusting room conditions to take advantage of the Ocean Beach charm. At $220, this was robbery pure and simple. The supposed recent 2 million dollar renovation didn't include this room. You might ask what was wrong? 1) Paint peeling off the walls in several places. 2) drawer handles missing from the furniture. I guess handles weren't really necessary since the drawers were cracked and didn't really close anyway. 3) I put on white ankle socks which were filthy in 10 seconds. I realize that it's hard to keep things clean at the beach, but that was just gross. 4) Baseboards cracked and didn't come together with the door jambs. I guess the dirt was keeping them apart. 5) The "patio" had a table and four chairs, one dead plant, empty planters, weeds, and a chunk of concrete missing from the wall. 6) Missing faceplates and exposed wires on electrical outlet. We checked in and tried to get on online to find another place, but couldn't connect to the free wi-fi. After about an hour, we told the front desk clerk (in person because the phone did not work) that we preferred not to stay, and were told that they would be keeping the money for the night ($245 after taxes). No curiosity about why we were dissatisfied. We checked out the next morning (2 days early), and the same person who checked us in did not even asked why we were leaving. When looking on Trip Advisor when we returned, there was a positive review from some other people who just walked in off the street without a reservation less than a week before and paid only $130, a much better price. Why were we, with a reservation, charged almost $100 more? Bottom line, unless you're a college kid looking for a beach flop with your buddies, find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: serena99
Reviews.Content: we arrived about 5pm in san diego from phoenix and were tired from the drive. coming off the highway we arrived at ocean beach by chance, and were glad to get out to stretch our legs. as we needed a hotel we asked at this place, the only one we'd seen along the beach. it was in a sort of luxury garden behind a glass wall - looked so appealing! they said there were rooms available for 132$ per night - more than we had planned on but we decided that we would book 2 nights so we could take advantage of the beach across the road. we were not disappointed. room was lovely, spacious, with big tv, dining table &chairs, kingsize bed and fridge. only thing wrong was that you couldn't make coffee (free coffee in the reception in the morning) we also had free parking during our stay which was great. definitely good price-quality, and quiet during our stay

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations and service with ocean air and beach views!”
Reviews.Author: ndmzoo
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our four day stay at the Ocean Beach Hotel in Ocean Beach, CA. We had two ground floor rooms and opted for one dog friendly room with patio. It was great, ceramic tile floors, no worries, a lovely inner courtyard and all this just across the street from the beach! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bet for traveling with a dog with a Bonus room by the Beach”
Reviews.Author: bedibye
Reviews.Content: My stay was for 3 nights and traveling with my Yellow Labrador for the first time, the hotel made my stay very comfortable. I was not expecting a lot out this hotel, but the rustic ambiance was surpringly good. Being on the beach has its perks and its drawbacks. Obviously, being on the beach was convenient and the sound of the ocean can be heard at night. However, since Ocean Beach is a young oriented town, there was a lot of noise late into the night. Being tired from the days activities, however, allowed me to sleep thru it. The walls were very thin and the noise from adjoining rooms was 'there'. If you're looking for a convenient hotel with a great location that is clean, this is the place for you. It's not for everybody, but I have to admit I enjoyed my stay and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: lmg2009
Reviews.Content: OB Hotel is like a little paradise right in the middle of all the action. There is a beautiful courtyard filled with flowers. You just have to cross a small street to get to the beach. The staff are professional and very helpful with directions. The rooms were small but nice with a nice size refrigerator and microwave in each. The furnishing were nice and the bedding was beautiful and comfortable. The price was down right excellent!! The only downside is the walls between the rooms are thin. So you can pretty much hear what is going on in the rooms around yours, but with such a great city, no one spends much time in the rooms. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beach side acomodation”
Reviews.Author: tripsarefun90
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Beach Hotel is ideally situated on the beach front. Our room was basic but catered for our needs during our 4 day stay. On arrival the staf were friendly and welcoming but when I had an issue with my transport back to the airport the staff on duty were both un-helpful and un-interested. However this aside the hotel was comfortable for a short stop.

Reviews.Title: “more bang for your buck !”
Reviews.Author: 1957cameo
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms, comfortable beds, any balcony room is highly recomended, they alow you to view the ocean as well as the town life below. The staff is always accommodating and friendly. The beautiful, lush courtyard is meticulously maintained. For a relaxing southern Cal. beach experience, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Will be returning!”
Reviews.Author: acook824
Reviews.Content: It was the nicest hotel we could have stayed at in San Diego. We searched for 2 days pricing out hotels, being my first trip I wanted to say close to the water. We found OB Hotel and were not let down. Right on the beach, great location, great courtyard in the middle to sit and eat at. All rooms are partial ocean view (i think) no matter what room you can hear the sound of the ocean. The staff is wonderful and helpful with information. The downtown area is wonderful, farmers market on Wednesday, shopping and eatting are cheap and good. Close to mission beach / pacific beach. I would recommend to bar hoppers. This is a great hotel for friends and couples to stay at, very romatic and very beachy. A few downsides - rooms are small, a little bit bigger than a dorm. Nice that it has a fridge and microwave. Only 5 channels (but honestly, why would you be watching tv) and i wouldnt spend the extra money on a balcony. I read in some reviews about hippys and bums around, and there were a few, but all very nice. The locals were so helpful with recommendations and they were just nice in general. If you choose not to stay at this hotel I think that you will be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liverpoollover
Reviews.Content: This review is well over due and I should have written when I traveled but never got around to it. I was so excited to have a hotel on the beach with a balcony. I didnâ€™t mind spending a few extra dollars for these amenitites, (at the time this hotel was a bit more expensive that it is now) boy was I wrong! Yes, I did read that the rooms were going to small but that small, seriously! There was a dresser in the room that was probably from 1983 with 95% of the handles broken and not there, the room smelled moldy, paint was coming off the the bathroom walls, the shower rod was grossly rusty... and here is the kicker... there was someoneâ€™s name written on the bathroom wall!!!!! Needless to say, I would not recommend this place to a bum! We were supposed to stay here for 5 days and the next day we checked out and got a full refund. Disgusting!!!

Reviews.Title: “ON THE BEACH while hearing the waves crashing as you are lulled to sleep!!!”
Reviews.Author: Langston99
Reviews.Content: We had never been to San Diego but are beach bums so this was the perfect place for us to celebrate a birthday! The rooms were clean (but humid as you can imagine being almost in the ocean;), bathrooms renovated and little heater was perfect for at night! The staff are polite and very not-in-your-business which is nice but they could have some hints of neighborhood/touristy stuff in the rooms. Even a free map of the beaches would have been lovely. Overall, this place is great and right now they have a deal, so pay a little extra on do the King Suite, it is so worth the extra!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room 301 only-Makes a difference-Read (red) all reviews”
Reviews.Author: Islan_Stylin
Reviews.Content: What a nice find! First my trip setup: Was on a San Diego sightseeing trip with my wife and 2.5 year old. Planned to see the San Diego Zoo mostly. Arrived by car from Orange County, CA. Length of trip in San Diego planned 2 nights 3 days, actual 3 nights and 4 days (The Ocean Beach was the add-on night). Stayed for 2 nights at a Comfort Inn near hotel circle (the one next to a steakhouse). Room was nice, but called a queen size bed a King, free breakfast, free internet; ask for coupon deals for local sights. So we did the Zoo thing despite the rainy weather for that 16/17th Feb. Was paying 80.00 per night for a room/TV/fridge/no micro/view-hillside and train route. This being the scenario, I was ready to make the family happier. I searched for hotels by the ocean as I got word I could extend my trip and came across the Ocean Beach Hotel. The attraction was, close proximity to the ocean, and nearby Pier to walk out on. The posted pictures of the hotel were hard to visualize, and seemed out of date after the fact (good thing). Seemed like they might have had a recent renovation to Room 301, which was the one we stayed in, "By the way is the best suite in the house". For the Splurge traveler or ocean lover it's a nice spot. I did not view any of the other rooms so cannot comment on that. Room 301 is the closest to the pier and ocean, with balcony on the Newport ave. side(not so appealing), but (2) double French doors facing the Ocean(no balconies)(To be able to hear the ocean before sleeping, and waking in the morning was worth the low season rate of 200.00/350.00 high season). Keep in mind this is a beach community and not a Major hotel, as you will climb 3 flights of open-air stairs to get to your room. Room amenities were complete and other reviews were pretty accurate, but maybe did not apply to this room (this is the best room in the house). Toilet paper was as reviewed by another reviewer, but his solution was good by using a local store up the south side of Newport Ave. I have a feeling the garden view and partial ocean view rooms were not as clean or updated possibly. Air conditioner was a portable unit and no cooling was necessary. Small table with 2 chairs, a couch (could serve as a bed although not a sofa sleeper); armoire with TV / remote no pay per view etc., another table for 3 near foot of bed (perfect for relaxing/wine/sunset/internet research/etc.). Portable, faux fireplace electric heater (seemed out of place but functional, and impromptu romance prop with imagination)(came in very handy), King size bed comfy enough. The garden patio area is nicer than the photos, the archways at the ocean end are covered with Plexiglas to prevent intrusions and has a room-key access door to the beach very handy oh yes and the shower so you can rinse off before going to your room or relaxing in the patio. Handy as the beach showers are a fair distance away to rinse off. Nice not to be nicked for parking like most other places. Did not look for ice machine or soda etc. but did see a laundry area which would be nice for the extend stay. If I could afford it, I would stay in that room for every San Diego trip especially during the summer. I would say try it for a night during low season to see how you like it if finances is a factor. There could be other equals or better but I didnâ€™t have the time as this was on the fly...I just wanted to relax, hear the ocean and take the family on the pier for the sunset which we did. Note: 2 things re: the pier: There seems to be a small element of hippy type or housing challenged that were in the vicinity of the stairs to get to the pier level but appeared not to be a problem. Across the hotel/Inn/motel from Newport Ave is a public parking for the pier/beach with a police building in it (hours of operating is unknown). The other thing is if you have a young child walking out to the end you might want to have a stroller of some sort to pull rather than carry them back...your shoulders or back will thank you. There is also a nice spot ON the pier for drive in/diner food-unknown quality...They also rent fishing tackle by hours or the day kind of nice for the closet fisherman. Again I would've tried this but we had other things to do...If you're very flexible with your travelling plan on being there for a Wednesday afternoon/evening as they have a farmer's market type of street fair which closes off a portion of Newport Ave. Very walking distance for a 2.5 year old...there was even an inflatable jumper thingy for free that gave us a break. Ample restaurants and bars to keep a variety of ages entertained. We ate at a Mexican restaurant on the north side (forgot name), but had gotten very full eating and sampling foods along the street. It did provide for breakfast the next morning, which worked out very well with the micro and frig. I urged my wife to take our son for a walk along the beach (about .7? mile each way to the far breakwater) I needed to plan the dayâ€™s activities so unfortunately I did not make the morning walk (this was a Thursday morning and no weekend crowds if there are any?). Cleanliness gave it a 4 since I always wear flip-flops in any room I book, but that room did appear clean. Service I gave it a 2 since I did not use any besides checking in and checking out, nor did I use the maid service. I did make my reservations over the phone (as I knew I wanted to book this special room not available over the net booking) and did not have any problems. Rooms was a 4 since I was unable to rate other rooms. Location a 5 for the beach across the street / above average pier even compared to Newport and Huntington beach / short walk to bars, restaurants, convenience store for supplies, and Wednesday street event / And last but not least is the sound of the soothing ocean sounds!...relaxing and priceless! If you expect your full money value to be in the room alone you might be a little disappointed, but overall value is there. Would have liked to's: Walk to the end of the southern part of beach to see tide pools at low tide. Fished of the pier. Eaten and had drinks at the pier diner (no rating on food sorry). Explored more of the general area for other hidden gems or hotspots. And last but not least is too sleep with the French doors open to fall asleep and wake to the sounds of the ocean (Didn't do this due to temperature and unknown bug/mosquito problems for my son). It has been a pleasure to share this with the world...hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: findcate
Reviews.Content: I think the location of the hotel is very special. It is right on the beach. The room itself feels like it needs a serious update.
